reviews.text: We just returned from 4 nights at this hotel in Beijing. I am a Starwood member, so tried to book all our vacation nights at Starwood properties. Unless you are on business, I would not stay at this hotel. Location is not ideal for sightseeing as it is not near the central part of Beijing. Hotel is dated. Indoor pool was freezing. We requested adjoining rooms since we were traveling with 4 young children and it took over 30 minutes and 2 different rooms before they finally put us in connecting rooms - seemed odd that they would not know what rooms were connecting and which were not.
reviews.title: Would not recommend this hotel for vacations

reviews.text: Once we learned the subway was 3 blocks away, we took the subway into the city, and that was great and very inexpensive and very easy. Much cheaper and easier than taxis.
reviews.title: Location in suburb, has seen better days

reviews.text: Ok, this hotel is not near the central part of the city. Also, it's been around a long time. I seen this hotel since I was in China over 20 years ago! So, it's a bit tired looking with old features and old room-style, and the hallway carpets seem original. Rooms are small, unless you get an upgrade with two bathrooms. Buffet breakfast on first floor is great, but you would be hard pressed to find something simple within walking distance from the hotel because it's located in commerical area. If you take subway, it's very near, however (but like any city it can be less safe especially later at night, yes, really!). I would recommend staying at the newer hotels if you need to stay in the area; otherwise you would be best to find a hotel nearer the city center (Wangfujing) since that is where the famous places are...and the shopping too...
reviews.title: Decent hotel with exceptional staff

reviews.text: I stayed here when the Delta screwed up my Emirates flight details. I used my Starwood points + cash for my reservation. The hotel staff was very helpful trying to help me ship my luggage to my home via DHL. I had excess luggage that Emirates wanted to charge 1000 RMB per 5 kg overage. I shipped 15kg with the hotel for $580. I didn't like to 20% service charge that they applied to everything in the hotel and especially disliked the food from room service (spicy chicken dish). The bed was very comfortable compared to other hotels I've stayed at in Beijing. I guess Starwood properties know how to get it right. The hotel shows its age and one of the first hotels I've stayed at with a tube tv instead of flat screen. I didn't go out, but did notice 2 subway stations near the hotel. At 4AM I decided to make my way to the service counter and ask for some water and then they sent it to my room for free. Beijing hotels usually charge extra for this. The buffet breakfast was decent, but very overpriced $25-35. They have a pool with a nice fitness center. The only downside is charging for internet service which seems to be standard with Starwood properties $12 for 24 hours. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, but if you have the extra money, then try another hotel.
reviews.title: Big hotel not offering more than expected

reviews.text: This Sheraton is not the newest and quite big. The rooms are a bit small (especially compared to the four points in hangzhou that i was in). It doesn't give you the wow effect than other hotels in that category might do.
